definition: dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: A few drinks will help to break the ice at the party.
sentences.chinese: 宴會上喝幾杯酒，會有助於人們打開話匣子。

sentences.english: Frank talked away like a chatter box.
sentences.chinese: 弗蘭克像個話匣子說個沒完。

sentences.english: Wei Gong opened the chatterbox, casually about their research on Feng shui.
sentences.chinese: 魏公便打開了話匣子，隨口講起自己對風水的研究。

sentences.english: He couldn’t have lasted five minutes with a chatterbox.
sentences.chinese: 他受不了話匣子，最多能忍耐五分鐘。

sentences.english: In front of the taxi drivers, I just firmly secured, chatterbox will be opened.
sentences.chinese: 眼前的這位出租車司機，我剛坐穩，話匣子便打開了。

sentences.english: He began speaking before Zanetta's buttocks had made contact with his chair.
sentences.chinese: 扎奈塔的屁股還沒沾上座位，他就打開了話匣子。

sentences.english: She is a chatterbox who never shuts up.
sentences.chinese: 她一打開話匣子就停不了。

sentences.english: Following the oral literary tradition of Arab culture, she joined in.
sentences.chinese: 她遵循阿拉伯的口述傳統，也打開話匣子。

sentences.english: A bottle of wine had loosened Jack's tongue.
sentences.chinese: 一瓶酒下肚，傑克的話匣子便翻開了。

sentences.english: And then your friend starts to open up just a little bit more.
sentences.chinese: 這時你的朋友打開了話匣子。

definition: smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)
the second person/(fig.) someone else/third party
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
to turn tears into laughter (idiom); to turn grief into happiness
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
neighbors/next-door neighbors/related work units/colleagues doing related work
